---
title: "CyTOF Titration Concentration Scorer"
author: "Michael de Kok"
date: "`r format(Sys.time(), '%d %B, %Y')`"
output:
  html_document:
    toc: yes
    toc_depth: 2
    toc_float: TRUE
    theme: united
    css: style.css
    version: 1.3
params:
  PREGATING_CHANNELS:
    label: "If the following markers exist, assign them to Pregating Channels and do not plot/score them. Seperated by spaces."
    value: "Ce140Di Ir191Di Ir193Di Rh103Di"
    input: text
  INSTRUMENT_CHANNELS:
    label: "If the following channels exist, assign them to Instrument Channels and do not plot/score them. Sperated by spaces."
    value: "Time Event_length Center SampleID Offset Width Residual FileNum"
    input: text
  PREAGES:
    label: "Perform the following pregates (with format 'channel{<or>}threshold'). Seperated by spaces."
    value: ""
    input: text
  SPILLOVER:
    label: "Perform the following actions regarding Spillover:"
    value: "Use Spillovers for Scoring"
    choices: ["Do Nothing", "Use Spillovers for Scoring", "Use Spillovers for Scoring & Compensate Data in Graphs"]
    input: select
  SPILLOVERMATRIX:
    label: "If previous is not 'Do Nothing', use the following Spillover Matrix file."
    value: "../Supplemental Data/Spillover_Fluidigm.xlsx"
    input: file
  MARKERNAMES:
    label: "Save files with marker names instead of metal names."
    value: FALSE
    input: checkbox     
  ARCSINH: 
    label: "Perform ArcSinh transformation on data."
    value: TRUE
    input: checkbox
  ARCSINHCOFAC: 
    label: "Cofactor to use during ArcSinh transformation."
    value: 5
    input: numeric            
  SCORES:
    label: "Names of score types, seperated by commas.*"
    value: "Intensity Score,AOF Score,Concentration Score,Spillover Score (Causing),Spillover Score (Receiving),Overall / Weighted Score"
    input: text
  K: 
    label: "Size of local neighborhood used for Area Overlap Frequency (AOF) calculation."
    value: 30
    input: numeric    
---

# 3. Data Preprocessing

```{r preprocessing}

## Spillover Correction using Spillover Matrix 
if (params$SPILLOVER != "Do Nothing") {
  #spillovermatrix <- spillover(x = fcs, )
  spillovermatrix <- readxl::read_xlsx(path = params$SPILLOVERMATRIX)
  spillovermatrix <- tibble::column_to_rownames(spillovermatrix, colnames(spillovermatrix)[1])
  compensationmatrix <- spillovermatrix[rownames(spillovermatrix) %in% colnames(fcs@exprs), colnames(spillovermatrix) %in% colnames(fcs@exprs)]
  spillovermarkers <- rownames(compensationmatrix)  
  if (params$SPILLOVER == "Give Warnings & Compensate Data") {
    fcs_compensated <- compensate(x = fcs, spillover = compensationmatrix)
    exprs_compensated <- as.data.frame(fcs_compensated@exprs)
    t(summary(exprs_compensated))
  }
}

## Data Pre-Gating
pregating <- function(x, pregate) {
  message(paste("Applying Pregate", pregate));
  if (grepl("<", pregate, fixed=TRUE)) {filterargs <- strsplit(pregate, split = "<")[[1]]; exprs2 <- dplyr::filter(x, filterargs[1] < as.numeric(filterargs[2]) ) };
  if (grepl(">", pregate, fixed=TRUE)) {filterargs <- strsplit(pregate, split = ">")[[1]]; exprs2 <- dplyr::filter(x, filterargs[1] > as.numeric(filterargs[2]) ) };
  num_removed <- dim(x)[1] - dim(exprs2)[1] 
  print(paste("Pregate", pregate, "applied succesfully.", num_removed, "cells have been filtered out.")) 
  return(exprs2) }

pregates <- strsplit(params$PREGATES, split = " ")[[1]] 
for (pregate in pregates) {exprs <- pregating(exprs, pregate)}

## Channel Description
pregating_channels <- strsplit(params$PREGATING_CHANNELS, split = " ")[[1]]
pregating_channels <- pregating_channels[pregating_channels %in% colnames(exprs)]
instrument_channels <- strsplit(params$INSTRUMENT_CHANNELS, split = " ")[[1]]
instrument_channels <- instrument_channels[instrument_channels %in% colnames(exprs)]
lineage_channels <- unlist(colnames(exprs))[!unlist(colnames(exprs)) %in% c(pregating_channels,instrument_channels)]

## Make colnames human readable using information in the parameter data slot

markers <- gsub(pattern = ".*_", replacement = "", x = as.vector(fcs@parameters@data$desc));
if (params$MARKERNAMES) {

} else {for (markerid in which(!is.na(markers))) {metalmarkers[[colnames(exprs)[markerid]]] <- markers[markerid]}}
```

# 4. Clustering for AOF Scoring

```{r clustering, echo = TRUE, results='hold', message=FALSE}

## Cluster Data and calculate AOF for each sample
AOFScores <- list()
exprs_spread <- list()
exprs$Sample <- NA
for (sample in 1:samplenumber) {
  message(paste("\nClustering Sample",sample,"out of", samplenumber))
  sampledata <- dplyr::filter(exprs, exprs$FileNum == sample)
  Rphenograph_out <- Rphenograph::Rphenograph(sampledata[,lineage_channels], K = params$K)
  AOF <- greedyCytometryAof(fcs_data = sampledata[,lineage_channels], y = Rphenograph_out[[2]]$membership)
  AOFScores[[sample]] <- column_to_rownames(.data = AOF, var = "ChannelName")
   
  ## Artificially spread data on x-axis instead of single value per sample
  sampledata <- dplyr::select(sampledata, -starts_with("Sample"))
  sampledata$Sample <- rnorm(n = length(sampledata$FileNum), mean = sample, sd = 0.1)
  exprs_spread[[sample]] <- sampledata
  }
exprs_spread <- rbind.fill(exprs_spread)

```

# 5. Analysing & Scoring

```{r scoring, warning = FALSE, results = "asis"}

## Set up Scoring Tables
scoretypes <- strsplit(params$SCORES, split = ",")[[1]] 
nr  <- samplenumber
nc  <- length(scoretypes)
ndf <- length(lineage_channels)
scores <- setNames(replicate(ndf,setNames(as.data.frame(matrix(nrow = nr, ncol = nc)),scoretypes),simplify=FALSE),lineage_channels)

## Set up Output Folder
if (params$MARKERNAMES) {dir.create(file.path(outputdir, "Markers"))} else {dir.create(file.path(outputdir, "Metals"))}
if (params$MARKERNAMES) {setwd(file.path(outputdir, "Markers"))} else {setwd(file.path(outputdir, "Metals"))}

## Function for calculating Density in Density Plots
get_density <- function(x, y, ...) {
  dens <- MASS::kde2d(x, y, ...)
  ix <- findInterval(x, dens$x)
  iy <- findInterval(y, dens$y)
  ii <- cbind(ix, iy)
  return(dens$z[ii])
}

## Function for plotting Density Plot
plotdensityplot <- function(x, y) {
  dat <- data.frame(x = unname(x), y = unname(y))
  dat <- dat[dat[2] > 0 ,]
  dat$density <- get_density(dat[,1], dat[,2], n = 400)
  return(ggplot(dat) + geom_point(aes(x, y, color = density), size = 1, show.legend = TRUE) + ylim(0, quantile(exprs[,marker], 0.9995))
 + scale_colour_gradientn(colours = colorRamps::matlab.like2(100)) + labs(title = paste(marker, "-", metalmarkers[[marker]]), x = "Concentration", y = "Expression") + theme(text = element_text(size=5), axis.text.x = element_text(size=5, hjust=1), axis.text.y = element_text(size=5, hjust=1)) + geom_rect(xmin = bestsamples[[marker]]-0.5, ymin = 0, xmax = bestsamples[[marker]]+0.5, ymax = quantile(exprs[,marker], 0.9994), color = "red", fill = NA))
}

## Main Marker Analysis Loop
bestsamples <- list()
for (marker in lineage_channels) {
  cat("\n\n## Marker:", marker)
  cat("\n")
  maxexpression <- quantile(exprs[,marker], 0.99)
  
  ## Check for spillover and give Spillover Table if possible
  if (params$SPILLOVER != "Do Nothing") {
    if (marker %in% spillovermarkers) {
      spillovercontributing <- as.data.frame(t(compensationmatrix[marker, ])) 
      colnames(spillovercontributing) <- "Contributing"
      spilloverreceiving <- data.frame(Receiving = compensationmatrix[, marker], row.names = spillovermarkers)
      spilloversummary <- data.frame(spillovercontributing, spilloverreceiving)
      spilloversummary <- spilloversummary[!(apply(spilloversummary, 1, function(x) all(is.na(x)))),]
      tkable <- knitr::kable(t(spilloversummary), caption = "Table Showing the spillover percentages both to and from other channels")
      tkable <- kable_styling(tkable , bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed", "responsive"), full_width = FALSE)
      print(tkable)
            
    } else {cat("\n- Marker", marker, "was not found in Spillover Matrix. Not checking, scoring or compensating for spillover.", sep = " ")}
  }

  ## Score Markers Per Titration, Basic Scoring
  scores$marker <- as.data.frame(scores$marker)
  for (sample in 1:samplenumber) {
    current_rows <- fcs@exprs[,"FileNum"] == sample
    sampledata <- dplyr::filter(exprs, exprs$FileNum == sample)[,marker]
    
    scores[[marker]][sample,scoretypes[1]] <- round((quantile(as.numeric(sampledata), 0.99)) / maxexpression, 2)
    #scores[[marker]][sample,scoretypes[2]] <- round(log((1-AOFScores[[sample]][marker,"Aof"])*100,10)/2,2)
    scores[[marker]][sample,scoretypes[2]] <- round(1-AOFScores[[sample]][marker,"Aof"],2)
    scores[[marker]][sample,scoretypes[3]] <- round(sqrt(sample / 10), 2)
    
    ## Spillover Scoring
    spillovermatrixmatrix <- compensationmatrix
    spillovermatrixmatrix[is.na(spillovermatrixmatrix)] <- 0    
    if (!(marker %in% spillovermarkers)) {scores[[marker]][sample,scoretypes[c(4,5)]] <- 1} else {
      
      ## Score Contributing Spillover
      spilloverscore <- 0
      for (spillovermarker in spillovermarkers) {
        if ((spillovermatrixmatrix[marker,spillovermarker] > 0) & (spillovermarker != marker)) {
          spilloverpercentage <- spillovermatrixmatrix[marker,spillovermarker]
          uncomp_maxspilloverexpression <- quantile(fcs@exprs[current_rows,spillovermarker], 0.99)
          uncomp_maxcurrentexpression <- quantile(fcs@exprs[current_rows,marker], 0.99)
          spillovermarkerscore <- (uncomp_maxcurrentexpression*(spilloverpercentage/100))/uncomp_maxspilloverexpression
          spilloverscore <- max(spilloverscore, spillovermarkerscore)
        }
      }
      scores[[marker]][sample,scoretypes[4]] <- round(max(1-spilloverscore, 0),2)

      ## Score Receiving Spillover
      spilloverscore <- 0
      for (spillovermarker in spillovermarkers) {
        if ((spillovermatrixmatrix[spillovermarker,marker] > 0) & (spillovermarker != marker)) {
          spilloverpercentage <- spillovermatrixmatrix[spillovermarker,marker]
          uncomp_maxspilloverexpression <- quantile(fcs@exprs[current_rows,spillovermarker], 0.99)
          uncomp_maxcurrentexpression <- quantile(fcs@exprs[current_rows,marker], 0.99)
          spillovermarkerscore <- (uncomp_maxspilloverexpression*(spilloverpercentage/100))/uncomp_maxcurrentexpression
          spilloverscore <- max(spilloverscore, spillovermarkerscore)
        }
      }
      scores[[marker]][sample,scoretypes[5]] <- round(max(1-spilloverscore, 0),2)      
    }
  }
  
  ## Corrections for Intensity Scores
  scores[[marker]][,scoretypes[1]] <- round(scores[[marker]][,scoretypes[1]] / (max(scores[[marker]][,scoretypes[1]])),2)
  scores[[marker]][scores[[marker]] == "NaN"] <- 0
  
  ## Calculate & Print Optimal Score
  scores[[marker]][,scoretypes[6]] <- round(rowMeans(scores[[marker]][,1:5]),2) 
  bestsamples[[marker]] <- as.numeric(rownames(scores[[marker]])[which.max(scores[[marker]]$`Overall / Weighted Score`)])
  tkable <- knitr::kable(x = t(as.data.frame(scores[[marker]])), caption = "Table Showing all scores for this Marker, for each Concentration.")
  tkable <- kable_styling(tkable , bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed", "responsive"), full_width = FALSE)
  print(tkable)
  
  ## Plot Density Plot for Report
  cat("\n- The Following Graph shows the intensity of each Concentration. Red box = Highest Overall Score.")
  if ((params$SPILLOVER == "Give Warnings & Compensate Data") & (marker %in% spillovermarkers)) 
    {cat("\n- This Graph has been compensated for Spillover effects.")} else {cat("\n- This Graph has NOT been compensated for any Spillover effects.")}
  plotdensityplot(x = exprs_spread["Sample"], y = exprs_spread[marker])
  
  ## Save Marker-Specific Plot and Score Table as output files
  ggsave(filename = paste("Graph for Marker ", marker, " - ", metalmarkers[[marker]], ".png", sep = ""))
  write.table(t(as.data.frame(scores[[marker]])), sep = "\t", file = paste("Scores for Marker ", marker, " - ", metalmarkers[[marker]], ".tsv", sep = ""), col.names = TRUE)}

## Write Summary Table
setwd(outputdir)
write.table(t(as.data.frame(bestsamples)), sep = "\t", file = "Optimal Marker Concentrations Summary.tsv", col.names = FALSE)

## Write R Workspace for future analysis
save.image(file = "R Workspace.Rdata")
```
